## Copied from the work on continuous p-values
```{r}

unbiased_p_val <- function(t_obs, pT, intT, E_T = NA, bndry_min = -Inf, bndry_max = Inf){
  # t_obs : Observed value of statistic T
  # pT : CDF of T
  # intT : t * f_T(t), needed to calulcate some expected values
  # E_T : Expected value of T
  
  if(is.na(E_T)){
    # Calculate E_T
    E_T = sum(sapply(seq(bndry_min, bndry_max), intT))
  }
  
  # Assuming that t_obs is single-valued
  
  return(find_t_dual_and_calc_tail_prob(t_obs, pT = pT, intT = intT, E_T = E_T, bndry_min = bndry_min, bndry_max = bndry_max))
  
}

find_t_dual_and_calc_tail_prob <- function(t_obs, pT, intT, E_T, bndry_min, bndry_max){
  # Checking if t_obs is left or right critical value
  if(t_obs < E_T){
    # Finding the 0 of the dual equation, t_dual
    # TODO : readable if we are at a upcrossing or downcrossing
    print(E_T)
    t_dual = bisection_discrete(dual_equation_high, lower = ceiling(E_T), upper = bndry_max, t_obs = t_obs, pT = pT, intT = intT, E_T = E_T, bndry_min = bndry_min, bndry_max = bndry_max)
    
    # calculating tails
    print(t_dual)
    # 1 - pT(t_dual -1) = P(T >= t_dual)
    p_val = 1 - pT(t_dual - 1) + pT(t_obs)
    return(p_val)
  }
  else{
    # Finding the 0 of the dual equation, t_dual
    t_dual = bisection_discrete(dual_equation_low, lower = bndry_min, upper = floor(E_T), t_obs = t_obs, pT = pT, intT = intT, E_T = E_T, bndry_min = bndry_min, bndry_max = bndry_max)
    
    # Calculating tails
    print(t_dual)
    # 1 - pT(t_dual -1) = P(T >= t_dual)
    p_val = 1  - pT(t_obs - 1) + pT(t_dual)
    return(p_val)
  }
}

bisection_discrete  <- function(f, lower, upper, ...){
  endCond = FALSE
  
  lower = round(lower)
  upper = round(upper)
  print(c(lower, upper))
  fl = f(lower, ...)
  fu = f(upper, ...)
  
  if(fl * fu > 0){
    # want to check if we want to add the whole tail
    fl_minus = f(lower -1, ...)
    if(fl_minus * fl < 0){
      print(c(fl_minus, fl))
      if(fl < 0){
        return(lower)
      }
      else{
        return(lower-1)
      }
      
    }
    print(c(fl_minus, fl))
    print("I tried")
    fu_plus = f(upper+1, ...)
    print(c(fu, fu_plus))
    if(fu * fu_plus < 0){
      if(fu < 0){
        return(upper)
      }
      else{
        return(upper+1)
      }
    }
    stop("Error : The endpoints are not of opposite sign")
  }
  while(!endCond){
    mid = round((lower + upper)/ 2)
    fm = f(mid, ...)
    if(fm * fl > 0){
      lower = mid
      fl = fm
    }
    else{
      upper = mid
      fu = fm
    }
    print(c(lower, mid, upper))
    if(upper - lower == 1){
      endCond = TRUE
    }
  }
  print(c(fl, fu))
  if(fl < 0){
    return(lower)
  }
  else{
    return(upper)
  }
  # add [1] if low value is wanted and [2] if high value is wanted
}

dual_equation_high <- function(t_prop, t_obs, pT, intT, E_T, bndry_min = -Inf, bndry_max = Inf){
  # Calculate integral(t * f_T) from t_obs to t_prop
  E_T_short = sum(sapply(c(seq(bndry_min, t_obs), seq(t_prop, bndry_max)), intT))
  # 1 - pT(x -1) + pT(y) = P(T >= x) + P(T <= y)
  E_T_short - (1- pT(t_prop - 1) + pT(t_obs)) * E_T # TODO: Can save pT(t_obs) from one iteration to the next
}

dual_equation_low<- function(t_prop, t_obs, pT, intT, E_T, bndry_min = -Inf, bndry_max = Inf){
  # Calculate integral(t * f_T) from t_prop to t_obs
  E_T_short = sum(sapply(c(seq(bndry_min, t_prop), seq(t_obs, bndry_max)), intT))
  # 1 - pT(x -1) + pT(y) = P(T >= x) + P(T <= y)
  E_T_short - (1 - pT(t_obs - 1) + pT(t_prop)) * E_T # TODO: Can save pT(t_obs) from one iteration to the next
}
```

# Calculating power (Copied from cont case)
```{r}

# 1. Find the critical values of t such that the p-values are below the significance level
find_crit_values <- function(method, significance_value,  ..., mid_point){
  
  modified_func <- function(t, ...){method(t, ...) - significance_value}
  # TODO : Update so we get automatic guess for mid-point
  t_1 <- bisection_discrete(modified_func, lower = -1, upper = floor(mid_point), ...)   
  t_2 <- bisection_discrete(modified_func, lower = ceiling(mid_point), upper = n+1, ...)
  return(c(t_1, t_2))
}

# It is important that they are passed as objects and not written directly as bndry_min = bndry_min in the function
bndry_min = -1
bndry_max = n+1
crit_binom_unb <- find_crit_values(unbiased_p_val, significance_value = 0.05, pT = pT, intT = intT, E_T = E_T, bndry_min = bndry_min, bndry_max = bndry_max, mid_point = E_T)

```
